### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Tiffany 's apartment space is the perfect spot if you 're staying in Boston .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: apartment space
	- sentiment_expression: perfect spot
	- target_entity: apartment
	- aspect_category: location
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: you
	- opinion_holder_entity: guest
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

text: By far one of the best locations you could stay at in Boston .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: By far one of the best locations you could stay at in Boston .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: location
	- sentiment_expression: one of the best
	- target_entity: hotel
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: you
	- opinion_holder_entity: guest
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Annotation Instructions:
You are tasked with annotating a provided text for various opinion components. Follow the ontological descriptions and format guidelines to accurately capture the opinion information within the text.

### OWL Functional Syntax description of opinion:

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Everything was super clean .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: super clean
	- target_entity: environment
	- aspect_category: cleanliness
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Entry was simple and easy .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: entry
	- sentiment_expression: simple and easy
	- target_entity: process
	- aspect_category: usability
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: user
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Great location close to the Commons .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: location
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: location
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: close to the Commons
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: My hosts made me feel welcome the second I entered the home , helping me carry my items upstairs , explaining where everything was and offering me breakfast and coffee in the morning .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: hosts
	- sentiment_expression: made me feel welcome
	- target_entity: hosts
	- aspect_category: hospitality
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: guest
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: hosts
	- sentiment_expression: helping me carry my items upstairs , explaining where everything was and offering me breakfast and coffee in the morning
	- target_entity: hosts
	- aspect_category: helpfulness
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: guest
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: This location does not have a kitchen and you must share a bathroom .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: kitchen
	- sentiment_expression: does not have
	- target_entity: location
	- aspect_category: amenities
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: bathroom
	- sentiment_expression: must share
	- target_entity: bathroom
	- aspect_category: amenities
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: The hit was the rooftop which allowed for 360 degree views which was perfect for the 70-80 degree weather we were enjoying .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1

	- sentiment_expression: hit
	- target_entity: rooftop
	- aspect_category: location
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: allowed for 360 degree views which was perfect for the 70-80 degree weather we were enjoying

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: views
	- sentiment_expression: perfect
	- target_entity: views
	- aspect_category: visual_appeal
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: I highly recommend it !

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: highly recommend
	- target_entity: product
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A

	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

	- opinion_holder_span: N/A

	- opinion_qualifier: N/A

- Opinion 2

	- target_entity: service

	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: customer

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: I enjoy dancing with these shoes on my feet .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: shoes
	- sentiment_expression: enjoy dancing
	- target_entity: shoes
	- aspect_category: functionality
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: The transition option is nice too so you can wear them as leggings .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: transition option
	- sentiment_expression: nice
	- target_entity: transition option
	- aspect_category: functionality
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: you
	- opinion_holder_entity: user
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: so you can wear them as leggings

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: They hold up great !

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1

	- sentiment_expression: great

	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: they
	- opinion_holder_entity: N/A
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: I have always worn LifeStride shoes but was disappointed when they were not leather and they were made in China .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: LifeStride shoes
	- sentiment_expression: disappointed
	- target_entity: shoes
	- aspect_category: material
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: they were not leather and they were made in China

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: origin
	- sentiment_expression: disappointed
	- target_entity: shoes
	- aspect_category: origin
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: they were made in China

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: They slot over the abdomen as I was putting them on very carefully this morning -could not wear them , will return .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: could not wear them
	- target_entity: product
	- aspect_category: fit
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: they
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: slot over the abdomen as I was putting them on very carefully this morning

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: will return
	- target_entity: product
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: they
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: could not wear them

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: These are the most comfortable shoes I 've ever worn , and they 're stylish .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: shoes
	- sentiment_expression: most comfortable
	- target_entity: shoes
	- aspect_category: comfort
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: shoes
	- sentiment_expression: stylish
	- target_entity: shoes
	- aspect_category: appearance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: These shoes are great .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: shoes
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: My husband loves his boots , excellent quality .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: boots
	- sentiment_expression: excellent quality
	- target_entity: boots
	- aspect_category: quality
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: my husband
	- opinion_holder_entity: husband
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A
